repnme.cdata!:
China - Tri-Provincial Highway Project, and
            Hubei Xiaogan- Xiangfan Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Tri-Provincial Highway
            Project, and Hubei Xiaogan- Xiangfan Highway Project for
            China were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk
            to development outcome was negligible to low, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: 1) it is
            important to ensure during project preparation that the
            mandate of the implementing entity is consistent with the
            scope of the project. The implementation of the two highway
            projects in China proved unexpectedly challenging because
            the implementing entity had no jurisdiction over the rural
            roads and the traffic safety components; 2) some adjustments
            in the scheduling of safeguards procedures can be
            considered. The completion of the full resettlement action
            plan before the preliminary engineering highway design was
            completed wasted scarce resources as it had to be re-done
            because the road alignments changed significantly; and 3)
            since the gap between safeguard policies in the Bank and
            China on highway projects is now quite small, good
            supervision is the key to ensuring that the policies are
            followed. In China, at least in the provinces where the
            projects were assessed, performance-based project lending
            has sufficed in respect of safeguards, but the application
            of the country systems with periodic supervision by the Bank
            can be contemplated.

repnme.cdata!: China - Hubei Xiaoagan - Xiangfan Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Hubei Xiaoagan -
            Xiangfan Highway Project for China were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was low
            or negligible, the Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            the Borrower performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons
            learned included: it is important that the Task Teams allow
            sufficient time to properly inspect projects during the
            construction phase and that the team has the skills to cover
            all potential issues, especially road safety. With
            expressway projects such as the Xiaogan-Xiangfan Expressway
            (XXE), some 224 km long, it can take several days in the
            field to do a proper inspection. Budget and time constraints
            can lead to the temptation to reduce the time in the field,
            but this is to the detriment of the overall project. Through
            supervision visits, the Task Team helped identify a number
            of critical issues which, if left unresolved, will have
            potentially compromised the project's ability to meet
            the project development objective (PDO). The practice on
            Bank-financed expressway projects in China has been to
            include a local road improvement program, typically on the
            order of 10 percent of the total project size. These have
            been included to help further ensure that the projects
            benefit the poor.

repnme.cdata!: China - Hubei Xiaoagan - Xiangfan Highway Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Hubei Xiaogan - Xiangfan Highway
            Project will provide effective, safe, and efficiently
            managed transport infrastructure, to sustain socioeconomic
            development, trade, and regional integration in Hubei
            Province, as well as improve transport links to lagging
            western provinces. The project components will: 1) increase
            highway capacity, and regional integration, through capital
            investments in the construction of the Xiaogan - Xiangfan
            Expressway (XXE). It will link major industrial, and hub
            cities, and reach less developed counties in the western,
            and mountainous part of Hubei, stimulating socioeconomic
            development; 2) include a rural road improvement program, to
            facilitate accessibility in low-income areas. This component
            comprises various subprojects for the rehabilitation, and
            upgrade of existing road sections. The road selection
            criteria include county income levels, expected impacts on
            the population served, consistency with provincial
            priorities, and, economic rate of return; and, 3) strengthen
            the capacity, and sustainability of highway management in
            the Province, by building sector institutions, and
            facilitating institutional transition to the needs of a
            market economy. To this end, training programs will be
            provided for government agencies on highway planning,
            design, supervision, management and operation, and road safety.

1798567.trustfund:
TF038720-CHINA:  CHINA HGUBEI XIAOXIAN
            HIGHWAY, NH2, NH3, NH4,TF036643-CHINA - FOURTH NATIONAL AND
            SECOND FUJIAN PROVINCIAL HGIHWAYS

repnme.cdata!:
China - Hubei Xiaogan- Xiangfan Highway
            project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The main objective of the Hubei Xiaogan
            Xiangfan Highway project is to prod economic development,
            and trade in Hubei province, by improving its transport
            links. The increased transport capacity in the
            Xiaogan-Xiangfan corridor, while improving accessibility in
            low income areas, will nonetheless affect populations due to
            necessary reallocation needs. Thus, engineering designs will
            follow four basic principles: 1) avoid construction in areas
            close to towns, villages, schools, hospitals, factories, and
            mining areas; 2) avoid cultural heritage sites; 3) avoid
            cultivated, and ore deposits areas; and, 4) minimize
            disturbance to basic infrastructure. This resettlement
            action plan (RAP), based on public participation, looks at
            the activities to be carried following consultation with
            project affected people (PAP), and, assesses compensation as
            follows. The RAP aims at improving, or at least restore,
            living conditions of PAPs, and, stipulates that material
            losses will be compensated at replacement costs, with equal
            treatment in the absence of property ownership, rather
            providing help for recovery, and compensation on assets
            lost. Land compensation will be based at six times the
            annual average output value, per cultivated land unit, for a
            period of three years, while crop compensation shall be
            based on the classification of cultivated land levied.
            Grievance mechanisms include complaints and appeals at
            county/district levels, and the right to present lawsuits to
            civil courts. Volume II provides the policy framework for
            resettlement, and land acquisition.

docna.cdata!:
Policy framework for resettlement and land
            acquisition of rural roads components
